summary: This document appears to be a series of text messages or chat logs from July 10, 2019, between individuals at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The messages discuss Epstein needing a 'POFU' (likely a psychological or psychiatric evaluation form) for a crisis the following day and check on the status of a psychologist's work.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of being seen or checked on, possibly another inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Psy.D. Chief Psychologist
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the messages, a psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, discussing patient notes and Epstein's need for a POFU.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the inmate discussed, noted as needing a POFU (psychological/psychiatric evaluation form) for a crisis the following day.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist is responsible for Epstein's psychological evaluation, as indicated by the need to prepare a POFU for him.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein's Crisis Evaluation
events.description: Text messages indicate that Jeffrey Epstein will need a POFU (psychological/psychiatric evaluation form) the following day for a crisis.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 10, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death on July 11, 2019.
It shows internal communication at the Metropolitan Correctional Center about Epstein's psychological state, specifically noting he needed a 'POFU' for a crisis the next day.
The messages suggest routine monitoring of inmates, including Epstein and possibly another inmate named Tartaglione.
The correspondence highlights the role of the Chief Psychologist in assessing inmate mental health at the facility.
